brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of INGAP-Peptide in Patients With Type 1 Diabetes
brief_summary: Insulin is a chemical that the body needs in order to use or store sugar. It is made by a type of cell called a beta cell which resides in an organ known as the pancreas. Type 1 diabetes is a disease where the beta cells have been destroyed so that little or no insulin is made. Sugar levels rise in the blood as a result. INGAP-Peptide is being tested to attempt to create new beta cells in the pancreas, and to restore the ability to produce insulin in type 1 diabetic patients.
description: 1.5 mL, once daily, self-administered SC injection for 90 days
criteria: Inclusion Criteria - Age 18-65 - fasting C-peptide <0.3 ng/ml. - HbA1c <10% - history of onset of type 1 DM at or before 20 years of age. - Otherwise healthy
